text: Geoffrey II, de Château-Landon (born – died 1043–46) was a French nobleman and the Count of Gâtinais. == Career == Geoffrey was the son of Geoffrey, Count of Gâtinais, and Beatrice of Macon. She was the daughter of Aubry II of Mâcon.Kate Norgate, England Under the Angevin Kings, Vol. I (London; New York: Macmillan and Co., 1887), p. 250 He was born about the year 1000.K.S.B. Keats- Rohan, Family Trees and the Root of Politics; A Prosopography of Britain and France from the Tenth to the Twelfth Century (Woodbridge: The Boydell Press, 1997), p. 265 The Gâtinais was a key district on the northeast border of Orléans and Château-Landon was the capitol.Kate Norgate, England Under the Angevin Kings, Vol I (London; New York: Macmillan and Co., 1887). p. 249 he married Ermengarde-Blanche of Anjou, daughter of Fulk III Nerra.Jim Bradbury, 'Fulk le Réchin and the Origin of the Plantagenets', Studies in Medieval History Presented to R. Allen Brown, Ed. Christopher Harper-Bill, Christopher J. Holdsworth, Janet L. Nelson (The Boydell Press, 1989), p. 27 Together they were the ancestors of the House of Plantagenet. Geoffrey died about 1043–1046.Detlev Schwennicke, Europäische Stammtafeln: Stammtafeln zur Geschichte der Europäischen Staaten, Neue Folge, Band III Teilband 1 (Marburg, Germany: J. A. Stargardt, 1984), Tafel 116 After Geoffrey's death Ermengarde- Blanche married secondly Robert I, Duke of Burgundy.John Burke & Sir Bernard Burke, C.B., Burke's Peerage, Baronetage, and Knightage, Edited by Peter Townsend (Burke's Peerage Ltd.,London, 1963)p. xciii == Family == Together, Geoffrey and Ermengarde had: * Hildegarde de Château-Landon, she married c.1060 Joscelin I, Lord of Courtenay.Detlev Schwennicke, Europäische Stammtafeln|Europäische Stammtafeln: Stammtafeln zur Geschichte der Europäischen Staaten, Neue Folge, Band II (Marburg, Germany: J. A. Stargardt, 1984), Tafel 82 *Geoffrey III of Anjou. *Fulk IV, Count of Anjou ==References== Category:1040s deaths Category:French nobility Category:Year of birth unknown Category:1000s births
title: Geoffrey II, Count of Gâtinais
